column3: Many of the familiar little things that we use every day have typically evolved over a period of time to a state of familiarity. They balance form and function, elegance and economy, success and failure in ways that are not only acceptable, but also admirable.
Every individual suffers from the fear of failure, but you can change your destiny only when you overcome it.

There is a huge difference between failing and failure. Failing is trying something that you learn doesn't work. Failure is throwing in the towel and giving up. True success comes from failing repeatedly and as quickly as possible, before your cash or your willpower runs out.
Every stumble is not a fall, and every fall does not mean failure.
Elegance is not a dispensable luxury but a factor that decides between success and failure.
Mass transportation is doomed to failure in North America because a person's car is the only place where he can be alone and think.
Enjoy failure and learn from it. You can never learn from success.
I think I'm less afraid of failure than some others.
I think my whole life, because of where I came from, I had a fear of failure.

Because of my intense hopes for the youth of China, I feel very keenly my responsibility for their future success or failure. The fate of China lies in their hands. The responsibility for organizing and training them to become worthy citizens of China, able to undertake the tasks of Resistance and Reconstruction, is mine; I cannot evade it.
The point is not to take the world's opinion as a guiding star but to go one's way in life and working unerringly, neither depressed by failure nor seduced by applause.

Success comes when people act together; failure tends to happen alone.

The guns and the bombs, the rockets and the warships, are all symbols of human failure.
To err is human, but it feels divine.
Never walk away from failure. On the contrary, study it carefully and imaginatively for its hidden assets.
Remember that failure is an event, not a person.
Our failings sometimes bind us to one another as closely as could virtue itself.
Failure is always an option.
There is no such thing as darkness; only a failure to see.
You get so afraid of failure and so afraid of losing and so afraid of not being the best that it's not a natural drive - it's born out of fear of failure. Which helps in Hollywood.
